member.name: T:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol
member.summary: A really simple/stupid protocol for Putty. The magic here is that clients connected to this protocol (TelNet, Arduino, Netduino or whatever) will be able to communicate cross-protocol with client talking RFC6455 for example (or any other implemented protocol).

member.name: M:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol.DoHandshake
member.summary: Perform any extra logic for handshake, build a hostresponse etc

member.name: M:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol.CanDoHeartbeat
member.summary: Set to true if your clients connected to this protocol will return pong on ping.

member.name: P:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol.GetPathRegex
member.summary: Extract the path (controller name) from the handshake

member.name: P:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol.ProtocolIdentifier
member.summary: A simple identifier fot the protocol since the ProtocolPattern might be complex or unfriendly to read.

member.name: P:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol.ProtocolPattern
member.summary: The string to identify the protocol in the handshake

member.name: P:XSockets.CustomProtocol.PuttyProtocol.HostResponse
member.summary: The string to return after handshake
